communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: To Date, 2025-2026 School Assignment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

In the CPS Procedural Manual, it states, "The IEP team then submits a school assignment request to ODLSS to provide the appropriate school closest to the student’s residence that can implement the IEP."

Provide records sufficient to show the following:

1. Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of CPS students with IEPs requiring placement for the 2025-2026 (to date) school year. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the date the student enrolled.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Seaside - Yosemite at Broadway
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am stating the purpose of this request so that you may assist me as required by California Government Code (“Gov”) § 7922.600(a)(1). The purpose of this California Public Records Act request is to determine the existence or non-existence of a specific record. 

Please note that I am not requesting the record itself, only confirmation of its existence or non-existence. Thus, Civil Code § 1798.90.55, law enforcement exemptions, the public interest exemption or any other laws or exemptions do not apply to, and are not relevant to, this request. 

Please confirm the existence or non-existence of the following Flock Safety ALPR footage record:

License Plate: 9SYY133
Date: January 20, 2026
Time Frame: 11:15 AM - 11:20 AM
Camera Location: Yosemite at Broadway
Camera Lat/long: 36.60906219870352, -121.82934571084488

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Moore

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Capitola Revised Flock Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From the January 22, 2026 article in Lookout "Capitola, Watsonville intend to keep Flock cameras following Santa Cruz’s exit":

"After these data breaches, Capitola Police Chief Sarah Ryan made amendments to the city’s contract with Flock Safety..."

Please provide the amended contract with Flock Safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Syd Jones
